title: To Adonis
lines: Hear my prayer, O best, O many-named god.
Fine-haired, solitary, ever bursting with lovely song, Eubouleus, many-shaped, noble nurturer of all, male and female in one.
unwithering bloom, O Adonis, you vanish and then shine again in the fair season's turn.

Two-horned spirit of growth, much loved and wept for, fair one, joyful hunter, god of the luxuriant mane, desire is in you, O sweet blossom, O son of Aphrodite and Eros, born on the bed of lovely-tressed Persephone.
You dwell deep in murky Tartaros, then again toward Olympos you carry your blossoming body.
Come, O blessed one, bring earth's fruits to the initiates.
